text: Main building The Saint-Petersburg Elizabethan Institute (Russian: Санкт- Петербургский Елизаветинский институт) was a girls' school in Saint Petersburg in Russia between 1806 and 1918. It was a charity school, founded by Elizabeth Alexeievna (Louise of Baden) within the Patriotic Society (Russia). Originally a charity school with the purpose of educating the students in handicrafts to make the ideal wives and mothers but with the ability to support themselves if necessary, it became a fashionable girl school in the mid 19th-century. ==References== * Срезневский В. И. Исторический очерк Санкт-Петербургского Елизаветинского института. 1808-1908. — СПб., 1908 Category:Charities based in Russia Category:Social welfare charities Category:1806 establishments in the Russian Empire Category:1918 disestablishments in Russia Category:History of Saint Petersburg Category:Schools in Saint Petersburg Category:Educational institutions established in 1806 Category:Girls' schools in Russia
title: Saint-Petersburg Elizabethan Institute
